result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew Anton Sabo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>5-15g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)2.
  • Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:  all court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA; all applicable fees of supervision.
Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
All court costs, surcharges be paid through collection by DOC in an amount through collection by DOC in an amount or percentage the department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a conditin of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence and count three; but consecutive to count two. Credit for 464 days.

superMiscConds.notes: No drugs.  No possession, consumption, selling, distribution of illegal drugs.

Follow all rules of supervision.  
Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
AODA assessment.  Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute/maintain sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; also advised that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence and count three; but consecutive to count one.  Credit for zero days.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence/count.  Credit for 464 days.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Andrew Anton Sabo in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Daniel Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Private PSI reviewed and corrections made.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 8 YEARS with 464 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence and Count 3 but CONSECUTIVE to Count 2; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS with 0 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence and Count 3 but CONSECUTIVE to Count 1; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

As to Count 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS with 464 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program but IS eligible for the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Sentencing report provided by the defense received and filed.

Defendant Andrew Anton Sabo in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Daniel Murphy for Karl Peter Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for jury trial. Parties have reached an agreement. State orally withdraws amended information filed 9-19-2016 that added count 4 and 5. 

AS TO COUNT 1, 2 AND 3:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Certification of MOTION HEARING transcript commencing 08-03-2015 received and filed. (22 Pages.) CH
Copy of transcript forwarded to: ATTORNEY JOSEPH DOMASK.

Original Amended Information received and filed. 

Charges amended to add counts 4 and 5:

COUNT 4: MANUFACTURE OF CONTROLLED SUBSTANCE (TETRAHYDROCANNABINOLS) (>200-1,000 GRMAS OR >4-20 PLANTS), USE OF A DANGEROUS WEAPON, SECOND AND SUBSEQUENT OFFENSE, Contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 961.41(1)(h)2, 939.50(3)(h), 939.63(1)(b), 961.28(1)(b), a Class H Felony.

COUNT 5: KEEPING A DRUG HOUSE, USE OF A DANGEROUS WEAPON, Contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 961.42(1), 939.50(3)(i), 939(1)(b), a Class I Felony.
